description: From Middle English forshapen, forschapen (“to transform”), from Old English forsċieppan, forsċeppan (“to transform”), from Proto-Germanic *fra- + *skapjaną, equivalent to for- +‎ shape. Cognate with German verschaffen (“to provide, supply, furnish”), Swedish förskapa (“to cut out”).

verbs.description: forshape (third-person singular simple present forshapes, present participle forshaping, simple past forshaped, past participle forshaped or forshapen)

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To metamorphose; change the shape of; transform.
examples: Unkindelich he was transformed, That he which erst a man was formed, Into a woman was forshape, That was to him an angry jape.

entries.meaning: (transitive, obsolete) To put out of shape; distort; make misshapen; disfigure.
